title: AllTalk TTS Settings - Simple Explanations
description: This explains what each setting does in simple terms anyone can understand

Enable TTS.simple: Turns voice reading on or off
Enable TTS.detail: When ON, the computer will read responses out loud. When OFF, you only see text.

Autoplay.simple: Automatically plays the voice without clicking
Autoplay.detail: When ON, voices play immediately. When OFF, you click a play button to hear them.

Show Text.simple: Shows what the computer is saying as text
Show Text.detail: Displays the words being spoken so you can read along.

Character Voice.simple: The voice your AI character uses
Character Voice.detail: Pick from different voice styles - like choosing between a man's voice, woman's voice, or specific character voices.

Narrator Voice.simple: The voice that reads story parts
Narrator Voice.detail: A different voice that reads descriptions and non-dialogue parts, like a storyteller.

Language.detail: Choose English, Spanish, French, etc. The voice will pronounce words in that language.

Temperature.simple: How creative or wild the voice sounds
Temperature.detail: Low (0.1-0.3): Very consistent and predictable. High (0.7-1.0): More varied and expressive. Think boring newscaster vs excited friend.

Repetition Penalty.simple: Stops the voice from repeating words
Repetition Penalty.detail: Higher numbers (like 10) prevent saying the same word over and over. Lower numbers (like 1) allow more repetition.

Generation Speed.simple: How fast the computer makes the audio
Generation Speed.detail: 1.0 is normal speed. 0.5 is slower (better quality). 2.0 is faster (lower quality). Like choosing between fast food or a nice restaurant.

Pitch.simple: How high or low the voice sounds
Pitch.detail: Negative numbers make it deeper (like Darth Vader). Positive numbers make it higher (like a chipmunk). Zero is normal.

RVC Voice.detail: RVC = Retrieval-based Voice Conversion. It's like an Instagram filter but for voices - makes one voice sound like another person.

RVC Pitch.detail: Adjusts how high or low the voice filter makes things sound. Use this if the RVC voice sounds too squeaky or too deep.

Narrator Enabled.simple: Use a different voice for story parts
Narrator Enabled.detail: When ON, dialogue uses one voice and descriptions use another. Like an audiobook with multiple readers.

Non-Quoted Text Is.simple: What to do with text that isn't in quotes
Non-Quoted Text Is.detail: Choose if non-dialogue text is narration (read by narrator voice) or character thoughts (read by character voice).

DeepSpeed.simple: Makes voices faster on certain computers
DeepSpeed.detail: A speed boost for compatible graphics cards. Only works with specific hardware. Most people leave this OFF.

Low VRAM.detail: Turn ON if your computer is struggling or crashing. Makes things slower but more stable. Like lowering game graphics for better performance.

Streaming.simple: Start playing voice before it's fully ready
Streaming.detail: Like watching YouTube - starts playing while still loading. Faster to hear but might have pauses.

Model.detail: Different engines have different voice qualities and speeds. Like choosing between different brands of speakers.

Please Refresh Settings.solution: Click the 'Refresh settings & voices' button to load available voices

500 Server Error.solution: Usually means the selected voice doesn't exist or server needs restart

No Audio.problem: Everything looks like it's working but no sound
No Audio.solution: Check if 'Enable TTS' is ON and 'Autoplay' is ON. Also check computer volume.

Wrong Voice.problem: Different voice plays than what you selected
Wrong Voice.solution: Click 'Refresh settings & voices', then re-select your voice from the dropdown

tips.Best Quality: Use Temperature 0.3, Repetition Penalty 10, Generation Speed 1.0
tips.Fastest: Use Generation Speed 2.0, enable Streaming, turn on DeepSpeed if supported
tips.Most Stable: Turn on Low VRAM, use Generation Speed 1.0, disable Streaming
